metadata.Title: CVE-2019-11711 on Ubuntu 18.04 ESM (bionic) - medium
metadata.Description:
When an inner window is reused, it does not consider the use ofdocument.domain for cross-origin protections. If pages on differentsubdomains ever cooperatively use document.domain, then either page canabuse this to inject script into arbitrary pages on the other subdomain,even those that did not use document.domain to relax their origin security.This vulnerability affects Firefox ESR < 60.8, Firefox < 68, andThunderbird < 60.8.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2019-11711` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

firefox - 68.0+build3-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
firefox-geckodriver - 68.0+build3-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
firefox-globalmenu - 68.0+build3-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
firefox-mozsymbols - 68.0+build3-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
No subscription required

thunderbird - 1:60.8.0+build1-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
thunderbird-globalmenu - 1:60.8.0+build1-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
thunderbird-gnome-support - 1:60.8.0+build1-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
thunderbird-mozsymbols - 1:60.8.0+build1-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
xul-ext-calendar-timezones - 1:60.8.0+build1-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
xul-ext-gdata-provider - 1:60.8.0+build1-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
xul-ext-lightning - 1:60.8.0+build1-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
No subscription required
